question: Question_12_(j)
statement:
Mark each statement either True or False. You do not have to justify
your answer.

The matrix $A = \begin{bmatrix}
-0.6 & -0.8 \\ 
-0.8 & 0.6 
\end{bmatrix}$ is the matrix of rotation by some angle Î¸ in
$\displaystyle \mathbb{R}^{2}$?
sols:
\textbf{False}

In two dimensions every rotation matrix can be written in the
form\[\begin{bmatrix}
cos\theta & -sin\theta \\ 
sin\theta & cos\theta
\end{bmatrix},\] Row 1, Column 1 and Row 2, Column 2 don$^{\prime}$t
match.
